Primary_Text: Peteĩ kuña omba’apógui ikane’õva okaru kotýpe.
Analyzed_Word: peteĩ	kuña	o-mba’apo=gui	ikane’õ-va	o-karu	koty=pe
Translated_Text: A woman tired of work is eating in the room.
A woman tired of work is eating in the room.
A woman tired of work is eating in the room.
a woman who saw a man
Comment: The marking of a human direct object with =pe indicates that this is a subject relative. In the absence of this marking, word order can clarify the intended interpretation. Noun phrases that come before the subordinate -va forms tend to be interpreted as subjects.

Translated_Text: a woman who(m) a man saw
Comment: Word order clarifies the interpretation of this example, i.e. that it is an object relative.
